Functions

void my_debug (const char *file, const int line, char *format,...)
 This function is based on the 3rd/debug.c debug function and operates using a very similar mode. However, this function only outputs a debug message if the SHOW_DEBUG is enabled. Unfortunately, by the information that we have found, it isn't possible to call another function with optional parameters without change it. (see http://c-faq.com/varargs/handoff.html for reference)

 Count the number of lines of the given filename.

char* get_line_from_file ( char *  filename,
int  maxchars,
char *  label,
char *  separators,
char *  spacers 
)

Get the value of a configuration line from a file.

Parameters:
filenameto read the line from
maxcharsmaximum number of characters to read on each line
labelfrom the line
separatorsarray of separator characters that separate the label from it value
spacersarrays of spacer characters between the label and the separator, and the separator and the value
Returns:
string with the value read
Note:
the return string must be free'd manually after no longer necessary

void md5sum ( char *  md5sum_chars,
char *  filename 
)

Calculate the md5 sum from the given filename and store it on the md5sum_chars string. It uses the md5sum command line utility.

Parameters:
md5sum_charsstring to store the md5 sum
filenamestring with the file name to sum
Author:
Cláudio Esperança <cesperanc@gmail.com>, Diogo Serra <2081008@student.estg.ipleiria.pt>
void my_debug ( const char *  file,
const int  line,
char *  format,
  ... 
)

This function is based on the 3rd/debug.c debug function and operates using a very similar mode. However, this function only outputs a debug message if the SHOW_DEBUG is enabled. Unfortunately, by the information that we have found, it isn't possible to call another function with optional parameters without change it. (see http://c-faq.com/varargs/handoff.html for reference)

Parameters:
filestring with the filename that output the debug message
lineinteger with the line were this function was called
formatstring like the ones used with functions like "printf"
...variable number of parameters
See also:
debug
Author:
Cláudio Esperança <cesperanc@gmail.com>, Diogo Serra <2081008@student.estg.ipleiria.pt>
